Toxoplasmosis is a brain parasite that is much more likely to infect owners of cats.

Toxoplasmosis is a parasitic infection that is most commonly associated with cats. It is caused by the parasite Toxoplasma gondii, which can be found in the feces of cats. People can become infected by coming into contact with the parasite, either through direct contact with a cat's feces or by eating contaminated food or water.
